definition: to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Please accept this little gift as my esteem for you.
sentences.chinese: 奉上這小小的禮物，以表達我對您的崇高敬意。

sentences.english: Congratulations on your success in the national college entrance examination. I beg you to take this little gift as a souvenir.
sentences.chinese: 恭賀高考旗開得勝，奉上禮物以作紀念。

sentences.english: I enclosed a humble contribution towards the funds of your society.
sentences.chinese: 我謹爲貴會的基金奉上一筆微薄的捐款。

sentences.english: The Uruguay international scored one and assisted another during an all-action 90 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 烏拉圭國腳踢滿了全場，奉上一粒入球以及一次助攻。

sentences.english: For this first round of flat-out speed demons, we've drawn up a list of the six fastest cars sold in North America.
sentences.chinese: 第一輪盤點，我們奉上北美市場上六款速度黨。

sentences.english: The opening ceremony at the same time in the Chinese national dance and Beijing Opera performance.
sentences.chinese: 開幕式同時奉上了中國民族舞蹈和京劇表演。

sentences.english: On Teachers' Day, the whole class offered a bunch of flowers to Professor Zhang.
sentences.chinese: 教師節那天，全班同學爲張老師奉上了一束鮮花。

sentences.english: Aaron is to offer the bull for his own sin offering to make atonement for himself and his household.
sentences.chinese: 亞倫要把贖罪祭的公牛奉上，爲自己和本家贖罪。

sentences.english: The chicken must be presented with a head, tail and feet to symbolize completeness.
sentences.chinese: 雞必須連同頭尾爪一起奉上，象徵有頭有尾幸福美滿。

definition: yours truly/yours sincerely (at the end of a letter)
to include (as a free gift, when buying sth)/to come with
